paragraph.content: A sufficient supply (and in any event not less than 1 roll) of zinc oxide adhesive plaster.*

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: A sufficient number of (and in any event not less than 6) 30 grams packets of absorbent cotton wool. (L.N. 238 of 1983)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: A pressure bandage.

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: A sufficient number of (and in any event not less than 6) safety pins.

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: A sufficient supply of eye baths.

statutoryNote.content: * The roll or each of the rolls to be at least 4.5 metres by 25 millimetres. (L.N. 238 of 1983)

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Requirements with which Certain Safety Equipment must Comply

section.name: s1
section.heading: Width of working platforms, gangways and runs

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the width of any working platform, gangway or run shall be not less than 400 millimetres.
Subject to subsection (3), the width of any gangway or run used for the movement of materials shall be not less than 650 millimetres.

Where it is impracticable by reason of limitations of space to provide a working platform, gangway or run of the width required by subsection (1) or (2), then, in lieu of complying with that subsection, the working platform, gangway or run shall be as wide as is reasonably practicable.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Working platforms, etc. to be closely boarded, etc.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), every working platform, gangway and run shall be closely boarded or planked.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to a working platform, gangway or run—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consisting of open metal work having interstices none of which exceeds 4 000 square millimetres in area; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the boards or planks of which are so secured as to prevent their moving and so placed that the space between adjacent boards or planks does not exceed 25 millimetres,

subsection.continued: if there is no risk of persons below the platform, gangway or run being struck by materials or articles falling through the platform, gangway or run.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Boards and planks in working platforms, gangways and runs
section.leadIn: Every board or plank forming part of a working platform, gangway or run shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be of sound construction, adequate strength and free from patent defect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be of a thickness capable of affording adequate security having regard to the distance between the supports and be not less than 200 millimetres in width and not less than 25 millimetres in thickness or not less than 150 millimetres in width when the board or plank exceeds 50 millimetres in thickness;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not protrude beyond its end support to a distance exceeding 150 millimetres unless it is sufficiently secured to prevent tipping;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: rest securely and evenly on its supports; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: rest on at least 3 supports unless, taking into account the distance between the supports and the thickness of the board or plank the conditions are such as to prevent undue or unequal sagging.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Coverings for opening
section.leadIn: Every covering provided for an opening shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: so constructed as to prevent the fall of persons, materials and articles; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: clearly and boldly marked as to show its purpose or be securely fixed in position.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Height of toe-boards, etc.
section.content: The height of a toe-board or other similar barrier shall be not less than 200 millimetres.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Height of guard-rails
section.leadIn: Subject to section 7, the height of a guard-rail above any place of work on a working platform, gangway, run or stairway shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a top guard-rail, not less than 900 millimetres and not more than 1 150 millimetres;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an intermediate guard-rail, not less than 450 millimetres and not more than 600 millimetres.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Exception to section 6
section.content: Section 6 shall not apply to a working platform on a bamboo scaffold if the platform is protected by not less than 2 horizontal bamboo members of the scaffold spaced at intervals between 750 millimetres to 900 millimetres.

heading.b: Temporary removal, etc. of guard-rails, etc.

subsection.content: Guard-rails, toe-boards and barriers may be removed or remain unerected for the time and to the extent necessary for the access of persons or the movement of materials or other purposes of the work concerned, but shall be replaced or erected as soon as practicable after the expiration of that time.
Toe-boards shall not be required for stairs.
